meanings.definition: Unable to be comforted or consoled.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was inconsolable after losing her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: She felt inconsolable when her best friend moved away.
meanings.sent3: The inconsolable puppy refused to eat his dinner until he got a belly rub.
meanings.sent4: His heart was an inconsolable ocean of grief, with no shore in sight.
meanings.sent5: The inconsolable widow visited her husband's grave every day, longing for his presence.

meanings.sent1: The inconsolable child cried for hours after losing his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: She was inconsolable when she failed her math test.
meanings.sent3: The inconsolable clown tried to make people laugh but ended up making them cry.
meanings.sent4: His inconsolable expression spoke volumes about the depth of his sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The inconsolable melody of the song touched the hearts of everyone in the room.
